typed: I am an IT Digital Imaging engineer.
I hope we can meet someday :D.

right.text:
Hey! My name is Vincent, I am a years old French graduated. I am an engineer who graduated from the IT Digital Imaging in the Ecole Supérieure d'Ingénieurs de Rennes (ESIR - Rennes 1). I wish you a welcome to my portfolio!

For more than years, computing, media, and electronics have taken more and more part of my daily life. Since my high school years, I started little by little to lead various projects. Which allowed me to discover computer science and to lead myself towards the development of software applications.

During my schooling, I obtained a UTD in Electrical Engineering and Industrial Computer Science which allowed me to discover electronics and industrial computer science. After this year, I decided to go on international mobility at the University of the West of Scotland (UWS) in Glasgow to learn 3D through a Bsc Game Development. After that, I joined an engineering school where I had the opportunity to follow a unique training in France because it was dedicated to the vast field of digital imaging.

I put my skills into practice during different internships. In particular, within innovative companies with strong expertise, either in startup such as Askelys in which I developed a 3D WebGL Unity interface for their semantic web API. Or, either during my professionalization contract for more than a year at the b<>com Technology Research Institute, by my contribution to the development of an open-source Augmented Reality Framework.

All these challenges allowed me to improve myself personally and professionally. You can find below some of my projects. Feel free to contact me to learn more about my profile.

Cheers

BCOM.title: b<>com training contract
BCOM.description:
Professional training contract (2019-2020)
Report and slides of my works at IRT b<>com

AsymetrieICP.title: Asymetrie ICP
AsymetrieICP.description:
This project rely on “An algorithm to map asymmetries of bilateral objects in point clouds” - Benoît Combès & al.
This algorithm able to automatically quantify the local asymmetries of bilateral structures in a point cloud by using Iterative Closest Point (ICP)

LunaAndHelios.title: A Story of Luna & Helios
LunaAndHelios.description:
This game has been released during the Game Jam 2020.
This event aimed was to build a video game in 35 hours on the subject : “Safe in the dark”

Tensors.title: Tensor directed stylization
Tensors.description:
This project rely on “Tensors-directed simulation of strokes for image stylization with hatching and contours” - David TSCHUMPERLE
Its describe an algorithm to generate sketches from color images directed by an image-dependent tensor-valued geometry

HDR.title: HDR
HDR.description: Experimentation of features related to High Dynamic Range (HDR) with OpenCV library

Askelys.title: Askelys Report
Askelys.description:
Internship
Report of my 4 months internship at Askelys a startup working in the Semantic Web. Development of a WebGL prototype on Unity

Kubic.title: Kubic Unity
Kubic.description: Unity development project, the aim of the project was to use navmesh

Ray.title: Pathtracing
Ray.description:
This project aimed was to implement features of a Raytracing engine and optimization structures related to it
Then in a second part Global Illumination and Pathtracing have been added to this project.

GOL.title: Game of Life
GOL.description:
GUI
designed to understand ergonomic concerns of an application for different level of users

TA.title: Tower Attack
TA.description:
Advanced Mobile Programming
Tower Attack Game, implementing advanced features like queues, stacks, and pathways

Orium.title: Orium
Orium.description:
3D Level Design
A game based on the time that the player will make to finish the game

Blog.title: Blog
Blog.description:
Creative Industries Blog
A blog to deal with the subject of the creative industries

Mutest.title: Mu-Test Report
Mutest.description:
Internship
Report of my 4 months internship at Mu-Test, a company working in the Automated Test Equipement (ATE)

Pacman.title: Pac Man XNA
Pacman.description:
C# Project
Development of the PacMan with the XNA framework

Monitoring.title: Monitoring
Monitoring.description:
UTD Project
HMI to provide data of a batteries monitoring system to the user
